intro: Voacanga megacarpa, commonly known as the African ivory tree, is a tropical tree native to Central and West Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its large, woody fruits that can grow up to 30 cm in length. The plant is notable for its ornamental value, featuring showy yellow flowers and smooth, greyish bark. Its seeds are encased in a hard, ivory-colored shell, which gives the tree its common name. The tree is also valued for its medicinal properties, with various parts used in traditional remedies.
